rationales.self_direction: Priya chose to work on her commission brief at a cafe on her own terms, ordering three cups of chai and defending her choice against her flatmate Neha's criticism.
rationales.stimulation: She feeds on the ambient noise and people-watching at Leopold's, using the bustling environment to spark creative ideas for her abstract floral mural.
rationales.hedonism: She ordered three cups of chai without guilt and let herself have a nice morning alongside productive work, explicitly defending the enjoyment as valid.
rationales.achievement: She completed the commission brief and the sketches are coming together with hidden eyes peeking through abstract florals, making concrete progress on a paid project.
rationales.conformity: She pushes back against Neha's framing that spending money on experiences when behind on rent is irresponsible, rejecting the social expectation of frugality.

rationales.self_direction: Priya asserts she KNOWS this is what she's meant to do, defending her artistic path against her mother's comparisons to Meera aunty's daughter at Infosys.
rationales.achievement: She painted until 3am and cites concrete career progress — the mural commission leading to more cafe chain work and a studio teaching approach.
rationales.security: She chose an artistic career with no salary, no benefits, and no predictable income, knowingly rejecting financial stability.
rationales.conformity: She hung up crying after fighting with her mother over career expectations, refusing to accept the conventional path her family demands.
rationales.tradition: Her mother's script — salary, benefits, husband — represents the cultural expectation Priya has deliberately rejected by dropping out of commerce and pursuing art.
rationales.benevolence: Her friend Rohan came over with biriyani and let her rant for an hour, and his support and advice ('outlast their doubt') shows the mutual care in their friendship.

rationales.self_direction: She reflects on what she would have been like if someone had let her make weird art as a child, reinforcing her commitment to creative autonomy.
rationales.stimulation: The teaching session involved novel creative exploration — texture collages with fabric scraps, sandpaper, and dried leaves — and she was inspired by Advait's unexpected artwork.
rationales.hedonism: She bought fancy dark chocolate on the way home 'because why not, the day was good,' treating herself to a small indulgence as celebration.
rationales.achievement: She ran a successful teaching workshop for seven kids and was professionally impressed by Advait's creative output, demonstrating competence in her craft.
rationales.benevolence: She nurtures children's creativity in her weekend workshops, giving them space to express themselves the way she wishes someone had done for her.

rationales.self_direction: Completing the Leopold mural on her own creative terms validates her autonomous career path — the owner loved it and wants more.
rationales.hedonism: She describes the moment of stepping back and seeing the finished piece as being able to 'breathe for the first time in weeks,' experiencing deep sensory and emotional satisfaction.
rationales.achievement: She finished the commission, the owner loved it, and he's already talking about his next location — a concrete professional success leading to repeat business.
rationales.security: The repeat interest from the cafe owner represents growing financial stability and predictable future income for her art career.

rationales.self_direction: She asserts she has already considered every possible path and deliberately chose this one, refusing Vikram uncle's suggestion of graphic design as a practical alternative.
rationales.achievement: She frames her career as a deliberate CHOICE that she has thought through more deeply than people in safe corporate jobs, taking pride in her commitment.
rationales.security: She continues to choose an unpredictable artistic career over the stability of 'something practical' like graphic design.
rationales.conformity: She bristles at being told what to do by an elder who assumes she hasn't thought it through, rejecting the social expectation to pursue conventional employment.
rationales.tradition: Vikram uncle represents the older generation's values about practical careers, and Priya explicitly rejects his advice and the cultural framework behind it.

rationales.self_direction: Even when running on fumes after three back-to-back workshops, she identifies the need to protect her energy, showing self-awareness about managing her autonomous lifestyle.
rationales.achievement: She completed three workshops in a row for good money, demonstrating professional output and earning capacity through her craft.

rationales.self_direction: She articulates a clear personal vision of success — a studio, enough commissions, unhurried mornings, freedom to say no — on entirely her own terms.
rationales.hedonism: She slept until noon, made a proper breakfast, watered plants, put on a Norah Jones record, and sat by the window sketching without forcing anything, fully savoring the quiet.
rationales.security: She allocated the mural money responsibly, putting half toward rent and supplies, while securing the other half for the Goa trip — balancing enjoyment with financial stability.
rationales.conformity: She argues it takes more courage to opt out of the rat race than to join it, explicitly rejecting society's narrow definition of success.
rationales.tradition: She rejects the culturally prescribed markers of success — salary, title, marriage, house — in favor of her own definition.
rationales.benevolence: She designated the Goa trip with Rohan and Meera as non-negotiable, prioritizing shared time with close friends as essential to her wellbeing.

rationales.self_direction: She declares 'this is what I work for — not to accumulate stuff, just to have these moments,' defining her purpose entirely on her own creative and experiential terms.
rationales.stimulation: The trip to Goa was full of new experiences — a tiny beach shack with incredible fish curry, sunset shots, filling half a sketchbook with quick studies of fishing boats and palm shadows.
rationales.hedonism: She went back to the same beach shack three nights in a row for the fish curry, describes sand in inappropriate places and a sunburn with zero regrets, embracing pure pleasure.
rationales.conformity: She frames her life philosophy in direct opposition to conventional productivity culture, asserting that 'the work will always be there, but time with people who matter' is the whole point.
rationales.benevolence: She celebrates Meera finally stopping her startup stress for five minutes and Rohan getting great sunset shots, finding joy in her friends' happiness alongside her own.
